abstract.text: Installs an event monitor that receives copies of events the system posts to this app prior to their dispatch.

inlineContent.text: An event mask specifying which events you wish to monitor. See
The event handler block object. It is passed the event to monitor. You can return the event unmodified, create and return a new NSEvent object, or return nil to stop the dispatching of the event.

Your handler will not be called for events that are consumed by nested event-tracking loops such as control tracking, menu tracking, or window dragging; only events that are dispatched through the applications
method will be passed to your handler.
The monitor Block is called for all future events that match
In OS X v 10.6, event monitors are only able to monitor the following event types:

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
Dispatches an event to other objects.
An object that contains information about an input action, such as a mouse click or a key press.
Constants that you use to filter out specific event types from the stream of incoming events.
Installs an event monitor that receives copies of events the system posts to other applications.
Installs an event monitor that receives copies of events the system posts to this app prior to their dispatch.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the key event is a repeat.
An event representing the current state of a tablet pointing device, including its location, pressure, and tilt.
An event representing the proximity of a pointing device to its tablet.
